intro: Anthephora punctulata, commonly known as the spotted anthephora, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest margins. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
